content.description:
Follow good but hard to find holds up the steeper bubble rock, and then pull up to the lower angle section of rock and get a rest. Finish the remainder of the climb as it turns vertical and technical, unlocking the tricky sequence before you pump off. This route climbs really neat features on very high quality stone. Great movement and a must-do!

This route is the furthest right of three routes on the brain-like rock. It starts just left of the big tan/yellow streak at the left side of the overhang/cave.
10 bolts, chain anchor.

Resistance climbing through small holds and decent pockets for the first few bolts to a mid-height hole. A no hands inverted knee bar is available here, but it's a lot less comfortable than just shaking out on the good holds. 

Traverse up and left, clip overhead and then boulder back onto the bolt line to the right. This is probably one of those 12b/13b routes depending on if you can span to the tufa! Blindly move your feet and grab the clipping jug. But wait, there's more - race the pump on jugs for a few more meters to the chains. It's maybe 5.10 after the last bolt, and it's completely dropable. 



The first bolt line that comes to the ground to the right of the brain rock. Distinct pocket between bolts 2 and 3, large hole to the left of bolt 4 with a blank looking section just above. 

6 bolts, cold shuts

Juggy slab climbing leads up the fae right of a corner sporting a hole.


8 bolts. Bolted anchor.

Great climbing right off the deck leads to a no-hands rest. Move through the overhang on cool, positive holds. Awesome movement. A must do for the Canyon.



In the middle of the Mind Games Wall, just to the right of Tree Enema (11b).

Bolts + chains

Start this route on a smattering of thin edges and sloping ledges, with slightly slick feet. Follow the vertical jugs and edges up to an off-balance crux before pulling onto the lower angle stone. Get a quick rest and finish up with a few more technical moves before the anchor.

This climb is on the left side of the Mind Games Wall. It climbs left of where the rock changes from yellow to blue-grey. The anchors are located on a large rectangle of blank-looking stone.
7 bolts to a chain anchor with rings.

Climb terrain that is harder than it looks to a high first bolt (stick clipping recommended, not overly hard but there is a bit of marginal rock). Solve a difficult to read but technically easy section to pass the 2nd bolt and gain a no hands rest. 

Clip your next 2 bolts from the no hands rest, and then charge up for the real climb. Climb quickly through the overhanging arete on tufa/tufa-like features. Tricky feet, balancey moves, and a dearth of rests give you the grade. There are no individually hard moves or sequences, but the climb is on you until you pull onto the slab! 

Keep it together and pull an easy slab move to gain the anchor clipping stance. 



Look for the overhanging arete, with a small ledge at the base of it (~7 m off the ground). This bolt line goes up the right side of the arete. 

6 bolts, anchor w biners

Climb the overhanging brainy rock through the 4 bolts. Angle eases off on the 4th bolt and you get a good rest after this. The next two bolts are on slab with good crimps. Take a rest into the next sustained overhanging section. Trend up and right onto a roof using big jugs facing in odd directions. Pull through this into the groove to the anchor. Soft 12a.


10 bolts to anchor, one more than the guidebooks say

A bouldery start, similar to Mind Bender (11d) to the right, leads to easier climbing until the very end. The crux is at the top and requires a big move off a meaty undercling.



Straight up the center of the "brain" rock, just to the left of the top 100 route Mind Bender (11d).

Bolts and bolted anchor.

Start via Brain Dead and traverse hard right after the 3rd bolt (mega length draw), or via Buddy's Route and traverse hard left after the 3rd bolt (mega length draw bolt 4). 

Continue up on decent sized holds to a rest stance just below the slab. Pull onto the slab and continue slightly up to the left to the anchors. 



Look for the bolt line that doesn't touch the ground - starting just over the roof to the right of the distinct brain rock. Start on either of the bolt lines that could feasibly link into it. 

9? bolts, rap rings.

Climb up to a right-facing corner, then traverse left and pull hard for a couple moves over a mini roof. The tree in question is no longer a problem!



Near the middle of the Mind Games Wall, between Frappuccino and Edge Grinder.

Bolts + chains

This wall is identified by the large patch of bubbly blue-grey rock that some refer to as "brain-like". It's mostly shady throughout the day. The wall is a little shorter than others in Black Feather Canyon, but the rock quality is very good.
